titleStmt.title: Sannati A.1 (Stele of Gautamīputra Śrī Sātakarṇi)

supportDesc.support: Limestone slab, 1.55m x 0.83m x 0.32m. The inscription is at the lower broad border of a sculptured stele, in two lines.

origin.origPlace: Sannati, discovered by J. Varaprasada Rao in the field behind the Inspection Bungalow during excavations in 1989.

div.p: This edition is based on Sarma and Varaprasada Rao 1993; the translation is by Andrew Ollett.

div.ab:
putasiri sātakaṇisa
samuditabalavāhanasa abhagavāhanasa sātavāhanasa beṃṇākaṭa-vidabha-uparigirāparanta-asaka-mūḍakasa jayavi cakoravalaraṭha dakhina
sūsakasa pitusatuveraniyātakasa anekasaṃgāmavijitavijayasa khakharatakulaghātakasa anekarājamathakapatigahitasa padanasāsanasa ekakusasa ekadhanudharasa

div.p: ... (Gautamīputra) Śrī Sātakarṇi, whose mounts and forces were on the rise, whose mounts were unstoppable ... the Sātavāhana, (lord of) Beṇākaṭa, Vidarbha, Uparagiri, Aparānta, Aśmaka, Mūlaka,, (lord of) Jayavi, Cakora, ... obedient (to his mother), chastener of the enmity of his father’s foes, who achieved victory in countless battles, who extinguished the Kṣaharāta race, who accepted the heads of countless kings, the primary source of rule, the single elephant-goad, the single archer ...
